Package cards.blue_cards

Class SkiAccident

java.lang.Object
cards.Card
cards.BlueCard
cards.blue_cards.SkiAccident
public class SkiAccident
extends BlueCard
Class implementing a Ski Accident blue card, which asks the player to pay 10000 to either the bank or the player with the Doctor career

The player pays a fixed amount of 10000.

      public static final int AMOUNT_PAY
      Amount to be paid by the player
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • SkiAccident

      public SkiAccident()
      Creates a Ski Accident blue card object

      In particular, a Ski Accident blue card is initialized with the name "Ski Accident" and the career match "Doctor".

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public int execute​(Player currPlayer, Player playerWithCareer, Bank b)
      Executes the action specified in this card.

      In particular, the player executes one of the following three actions:

      • If the player matches the career match of the card, they receive 15000 from the bank
      • If no player matches the career match of the card, the player will pay 10000 to the bank
      • If a different player matches the career match of the card, the player will pay 10000 to the other player
      Parameters:
      currPlayer - current player with turn
      playerWithCareer - player whose career matches the career specified in the card
      b - Bank of the game
      Returns:
      flag indicative of the executed scenario

    • getInfo

      public java.lang.String getInfo()
      Returns the base card description to be displayed as a prompt during the actual gameplay

      In particular, the card description reads as follows: "You drew a ski accident card."

      Specified by:
      getInfo in class Card
      Returns:
      base card description to be displayed as a prompt during the actual gameplay

    • getInfoBank

      public java.lang.String getInfoBank()
      Returns the card description to be displayed as a prompt during the actual gameplay if the player will pay money to the bank

      In particular, the card description reads as follows: "You drew a ski accident card. Pay 10000 to the bank for treatment fees."

      Specified by:
      getInfoBank in class BlueCard
      Returns:
      card description to be displayed as a prompt during the actual gameplay if the player will pay money to the bank

    • getInfoMatch

      public java.lang.String getInfoMatch()
      Returns the card description to be displayed as a prompt during the actual gameplay if the player will receive money

      In particular, the card description reads as follows: "You drew a ski accident card. Receive 15000 as a doctor."

      Specified by:
      getInfoMatch in class BlueCard
      Returns:
      card description to be displayed as a prompt during the actual gameplay if the player will receive money

    • getInfoOtherPlayer

      public java.lang.String getInfoOtherPlayer()
      Returns the card description to be displayed as a prompt during the actual gameplay if the player will pay money to another player

      In particular, the card description reads as follows: "You drew a ski accident card. Pay 10000 to the doctor for treatment fees."

      Specified by:
      getInfoOtherPlayer in class BlueCard
      Returns:
      card description to be displayed as a prompt during the actual gameplay if the player will pay money to another player

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this card, which includes its name and the amounts the player will pay depending on the scenario.

      In particular, the representation contains the following details:

      • Type of card (Blue card)
      • Name of the card (Ski Accident)
      • Career match of the card (Doctor)
      • The header "Received if Career Match" (which is a general description of the blue cards)
      • The amount 15000 (which is the same for all blue cards)
      • The header "Paid to Other Player (or Bank)" (which is a general description of the blue cards)
      • The constant 10000 (the value of the static final variable AMOUNT_PAY)
      Overrides:
      toString in class BlueCard
      Returns:
      string representation of this card
